class surveyor.models.Group(id, name)¶

Bases: django.db.models.base.Model

exception DoesNotExist¶

Bases: django.core.exceptions.ObjectDoesNotExist

exception MultipleObjectsReturned¶

Bases: django.core.exceptions.MultipleObjectsReturned

grouprespondent_set¶

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

groupsurveyor_set¶

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

id¶

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

user¶

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a one-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Restaurant(Model):
    place = OneToOneField(Place, related_name='restaurant')

Restaurant.place is a ForwardOneToOneDescriptor instance.

surveyor.utils module¶

surveyor.utils.create_word_cloud(responses)¶

Creates a word cloud from an iterable set of Responses. Response.text is not null for each Response.

Parameters

responses (iterable[Response]) – The Responses from which to create the word cloud.

Returns

A string representing the path of the bytestream of the word cloud image.

Return type

str

surveyor.utils.get_graphs_and_leaderboards(surveyor)¶

Retrieves a list of dictionaries containing the labels, scores, leaderboards and groups required to render the graphs and leaderboards for every group the surveyor manages.

Parameters

surveyor (Surveyor) – The Surveyor object representing the user that is currently logged in.

Returns

A list of dictionaries containing the id, title, labels, scores and leaderboard of every group managed by the currently logged in user.

Return type

List[dict]

surveyor.utils.get_group_participants(group)¶

Returns a django.db.models.QuerySet of the Respondent objects which represent the participants of group.

Parameters

group (Group) – The Group representing the group whose participants the method shall be querying.

Returns

A QuerySet of the Respondent objects who are part of group.

Return type

django.db.models.QuerySet

surveyor.utils.get_overall_word_cloud(surveyor, respondent)¶

Gets the combined word cloud for the all of the text responses given by a certain Respondent to tasks set by a given Surveyor.

Parameters

  • surveyor (Surveyor) – The Surveyor for which to get responses for.

  • respondent (Respondent) – The Respondent for which to get responses from.

Returns

A string representing the path of the bytestream of the word cloud image.

Return type

str

surveyor.utils.get_questions(pk_task)¶
surveyor.utils.sanitize_link(url)¶

Removes the protocol from the given URL.

Parameters

url (str) – The URL to be sanitized

Returns

The sanitized URL.

Return type

str

surveyor.views module¶

surveyor.views.dashboard(request)¶

The Dashboard page for the Surveyor. Displays each incomplete Task they have set, as well as an overview of the leaderboard and progress of each Group.

Parameters

request (django.http.HttpRequest) – The GET request made by the user.

Returns

The surveyor/dashboard.html template rendered using the given dictionary.

Return type

django.http.HttpResponse

surveyor.views.groups(request)¶

Displays a list of all the Groups which the Surveyor manages.

Parameters

request (django.http.HttpRequest) – The GET/POST request made by the user.

Returns

The surveyor/groups.html template rendered using the given dictionary.

Return type

django.http.HttpResponse

surveyor.views.history(request)¶

The Task History page for the Surveyor. Displays all of the previous tasks that the Surveyor has set.

Parameters

request (django.http.HttpRequest) – The GET request made by the user.

Returns

The surveyor/history.html template rendered using the given dictionary.

Return type

django.http.HttpResponse

surveyor.views.leaderboard(request)¶

The Leaderboard page for the Surveyor. Displays rankings for the Respondents in each Group.

Parameters

request (django.http.HttpRequest) – The GET request made by the user.

Returns

The surveyor/leaderboard.html template rendered using the given dictionary.

Return type

django.http.HttpResponse

surveyor.views.manage_group(request, pk_group)¶

The page allowing for the management (addition/deletion) of Respondents in a group.

Parameters

  • request (django.http.HttpRequest) – The GET/POST request made by the user.

  • pk_group (uuid.UUID) – Primary key of the Group object stored in the database.

Returns

The surveyor/manage_group.html template rendered using the given dictionary.

Return type

django.http.HttpResponse

surveyor.views.new_group(request)¶

Modal popup containing a form for the creation of a new Group.

Parameters

request (django.http.HttpRequest) – The GET/POST request made by the user.

Returns

The surveyor/partials/new_group.html template rendered using the given dictionary.

Return type

django.http.HttpResponse

surveyor.views.new_task(request)¶

The page containing the form for creating a new Task.

Parameters

request (django.http.HttpRequest) – The GET/POST request made by the user.

Returns

The surveyor/new_task.html template rendered using the given dictionary.

Return type

django.http.HttpResponse

surveyor.views.task_overview(request, pk_task)¶

Summary page containing the collective responses of the group which has been assigned a Task. Categorical responses are visualised using either Bar or Pie charts and textual responses are visualised in word clouds.

Parameters

  • request (django.http.HttpRequest) – GET request made by the current Surveyor.

  • pk_task (uuid.UUID) – The UUID primary key of the Task object being queried for a summary of responses.

Returns

The surveyor/task_overview.html template rendered using the given dictionary.

Return type

django.http.HttpResponse

surveyor.views.user_progress(request, pk_user)¶

The user progress page for an individual Respondent. Displays all of the previous tasks set by the current Surveyor which the Respondent has responded to, the progress that they’ve shown and their individual responses to these tasks.

Parameters

  • request (django.http.HttpRequest) – GET request made by the current user.

  • pk_user (uuid.UUID) – Primary key of the Surveyor accessing the page.

Returns

The surveyor/user_progress.html template rendered using the given dictionary.

Return type

django.http.HttpResponse

surveyor.views.user_response(request, pk_user, pk_task)¶

The page showing the Response of a Respondent to a given Task.

Parameters

  • request (django.http.HttpRequest) – The GET request made by the user.

  • pk_user (uuid.UUID) – The primary key of the Respondent.

  • pk_task (uuid.UUID) – The primary key of the Task.

Returns

The surveyor/user_response.html template rendered using the given dictionary.

Return type

django.http.HttpResponse
